{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3075421,"name":"Brett B Bonner","username":"bbonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bbonner/{size}/155176_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T03:07:55.294Z","cooked":"

Looking for advice from the hive mind here…

We’ve been using a Probotix Meteor CNC router for ~5 years, with a Bosch woodworking router + a SuperPID closed-loop speed control in lieu of a spindle + VFD. For multiple reasons I’m now looking at upgrading to a spindle. I’d been assuming a water-cooled spindle was the way to go, but Probotix tells me they rarely sell water cooled spindles any more as most people don’t want to manage the water (though they do still carry them).

On the flip side it also seems to be universally agreed - and it’s also my experience with our Omio - that water cooled are quieter, which is one of several reasons I’d like to get away from the router. I’ve also read that the noise difference in the spindle itself is largely irrelevant as the cutting noise dominates regardless. But I’ve never worked with an air cooled spindle, only screaming router motors, so I’m missing that point of comparison.

If I do go water-cooled I would probably find a radiator system (like this one) from the get-go. But honestly if I can skip the plumbing, mounting, and fluid-management challenges I’d just as soon do so.

So: air or water cooling? I’m especially interested to hear from folks who have (or have tried) both kinds of spindles. Would you buy an air-cooled at this point since it’s simpler, less maintenance, and easier all around? Or is the classic water-cooled approach the clear winner for being quieter and maybe longer life, at the cost of complexity? Is it that much quieter to make it worth it?

BTW, price is about the same for the spindle itself, but the cooling components for the water-cooled will be extra. The small upfront cost difference isn’t huge; the cost is really in the complexity + therefore the time involved.

Thanks everyone!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T03:07:55.294Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2655,"reads":483,"readers_count":482,"score":13386.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"Brett B Bonner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://buildyourcnc.com/item/pneumatic-hydraulic-spindle-inverter-cooling-water-pump-reservoir-fan-radiator-g14fittings-silicone-tubing","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":86}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48574,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6328 Mentor - Electrical/Controls"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/1","custom_user_title":"6328 Mentor - Electrical/Controls","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3075424,"name":"Chadfrom7226","username":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T03:17:45.863Z","cooked":"

We did a spindle upgrade on our Laguna Swift 4x4 spindle

10/10 would recommend a CNC Depot spindle

We have an FM30C spindle. The ATC is a game changer

cncdepot

ATC Spindles for CNC Routing and Milling | Tennessee | CNC Depot

CNC Depot produces professional automation and manufacturing components for small scale production shops, OEM and DIY machine builders, including the S30 automatic tool change spindle.

Air cooled and doesn’t really get too hot for what we do

It’s about the same amount of noise as the liquid cooled spindle that was on it. Decently quiet when it’s not running. Cutting is loud for us no matter what

We use an air cooled for production work here at AndyMark and very rarely does it ever get hot to the point of concern. The only thing I would change about it, honestly, is to have a tool changer.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T11:40:48.139Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":390,"readers_count":389,"score":163.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"Jon K.","primary_group_name":"CTRE","flair_name":"CTRE","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/b/1bd2b430e1bb6427d1c6504ff6abcd31de851a6d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":57,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1038,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3075463,"name":"paulonis","username":"paulonis","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/5fc32e/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T12:17:17.904Z","cooked":"
bbonner:

I’ve also read that the noise difference in the spindle itself is largely irrelevant as the cutting noise dominates regardless. But I’ve never worked with an air cooled spindle, only screaming router motors, so I’m missing that point of comparison.

This.

I haven’t used a water-cooled spindle, but I have used routers and air-cooled spindles. The air-cooled spindles are MUCH quieter than a router. The light WOOSH sound of the air-cooled spindle is overwhelmed by cutting noise. I can’t imagine that spindle noise would be a factor in deciding between air and water cooling.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T12:17:17.904Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":378,"readers_count":377,"score":135.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"paulonis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22261,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3075471,"name":"","username":"D_Inspector","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/4af34b/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T12:46:39.009Z","cooked":"

I haven’t used a water-cooled spindle, but the first time I turned on the spindle on a Velox, I thought I had done something wrong because I didn’t hear anything. After years of listening to a router, the air-cooled spindle was a miracle.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T12:46:39.009Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":342,"readers_count":341,"score":163.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53181,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3075474,"name":"This isn't a game. Think about the repercussions.","username":"DonRotolo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/donrotolo/{size}/177200_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T13:16:18.117Z","cooked":"

As mentioned, the air-cooled spindle is fine. It is designed to be properly and fully cooled by air. Water spindles can possibly deliver more energy to the cut, but for FRC that is rarely a consideration. Your machine is more likely power-limited by the steppers power and frame rigidity

Our router spindle (2.2 kw 220V) uses air, it never gets more than warm, has plenty of power in aluminum and is whisper quiet.

My vote: air cooled.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T13:16:18.117Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":328,"readers_count":327,"score":120.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"This isn't a game. Think about the repercussions.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4207,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"No Longer Registered"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/6","custom_user_title":"No Longer Registered","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3075482,"name":"Joe Derrick","username":"Joe_Derrick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_derrick/{size}/6055_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T13:41:40.633Z","cooked":"

This thread is of interest to us for our OMIO Setup. We currently are using the supplied water pump to cool the spindle, but as mentioned, the water management is somewhat labor intensive.

We also have a jobsite style compressor with a 6 gallon tank to run a “mister” directly onto the tool as it cuts. This compressor is louder than it seems like it needs to be.

Could we streamline our system by switching the spindle over to air and split that air onto the mister as well?

What type of pump/compressor would people recommended for Air cooling a Spindle?
Does a typical “Air Pump for Inflatables” work or is something more like a jobsite compressor with air tank required.

Thanks for any thoughts on this.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T13:41:40.633Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":314,"readers_count":313,"score":132.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"Joe Derrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18187,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"LakerBots 8046"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/7","custom_user_title":"LakerBots 8046","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3075484,"name":"paulonis","username":"paulonis","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/5fc32e/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T13:51:15.925Z","cooked":"

Air-cooled spindles use either a fan which is integral to the spindle or they use blades on the spindle shaft itself to provide air cooling. I’ve never seen an air-cooled spindle that needed an external source of air such as a compressor for cooling. I suppose something like that could exist, though.

EDIT: I realize now that the question was about blowing compressed air through the water-cooled spindle as an alternative to the water. It never crossed my mind that might be the question. The forced convection heat transfer coefficient of water is about 25-30 times that of air. A cooling system designed for water will barely cool at all with air.

California Air Tools is one manufacturer of quieter compressors. They aren’t quiet like an air-cooled spindle, but they might be about half the volume of “typical” compressors.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T16:00:48.772Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":287,"readers_count":286,"score":102.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"paulonis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":18187,"username":"Joe_Derrick","name":"Joe Derrick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_derrick/{size}/6055_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22261,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3075488,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T14:55:47.441Z","cooked":"

There are oil-less compressors that are RADICALLY quieter than the cheap oiled ones. Husky makes one.
If you can handle the lower pressure, air brush compressors are very quiet and might handle your spray cooling needs nicely. I use something like that for my chip blower/tool cooling air.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T14:55:47.441Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":265,"readers_count":264,"score":63.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/9","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3075490,"name":"Nick Aarestad","username":"cadandcookies","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cadandcookies/{size}/158154_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T15:02:37.467Z","cooked":"

Unfortunately this isn’t how it works. An air cooled spindle is an option when ordering direct from Omio, but trying to run the liquid spindle with air is going to quickly run into thermal issues.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T15:02:37.467Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":267,"readers_count":266,"score":63.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"Nick Aarestad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":18187,"username":"Joe_Derrick","name":"Joe Derrick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_derrick/{size}/6055_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17187,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3075493,"name":"JamesCH95","username":"JamesCH95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jamesch95/{size}/1200_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T15:16:33.760Z","cooked":"

My Kress air-cooled spindle is loud as heck, louder than typical cutting noise for me.

YMMV.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T15:16:33.760Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":272,"readers_count":271,"score":79.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"JamesCH95","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3782,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3075494,"name":"Smtopps","username":"Smtopps","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/smtopps/{size}/166758_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T15:16:42.010Z","cooked":"

We have a water cooled spindle which we got in 2018 and sometime in 2020 it blocked up and water doesn’t flow through it anymore. We have tried to clear it using compressed air, pumping water through either side of the spindle and have had no luck. If anyone has ideas that would be appreciated. For now we use the spindle anyway and we just pay attention to how hot it is. It will go for awhile without proper cooling but we don’t push it.

We suspect it is probably calcium build up or wood dust that may have gotten in the water and is clogged in the spindle. Here is what the water channels should look like which would be challenging to use pipe cleaners for. Compressed air will go through it but not water.

Laguna Spindle1778×1438 3.95 MB

We had a liquid cooled spindle before the FM30C, and we never had water pumping issues. We used antifreeze coolant pre mix from Advance Auto and it worked flawlessly. We don’t move out router around so the pump just stayed in the bucket and pumped forever. We really didn’t ever maintain that part

We used antifreeze because sometimes over break, our shop doesn’t stay heated

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T15:29:58.223Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":248,"readers_count":247,"score":59.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"Joe Derrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":17187,"username":"cadandcookies","name":"Nick Aarestad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cadandcookies/{size}/158154_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18187,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"LakerBots 8046"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/14","custom_user_title":"LakerBots 8046","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3075497,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T15:32:25.968Z","cooked":"

You might pull both the inlet and outlet fittings and look in to see what’s in there. Putting some vinegar into the hose and blowing it through the passages might be worth a try. Repeat a few times and see if you can get the flow rate higher. Once you get some level of circulation you can pump the vinegar through. Once you get it flowing decently, drain it. Circulate some water through it that has been dosed with a dash of baking soda to neutralize it and then flush it 2-3 times, replacing as much of the water as you can each time. Then change over to antifreeze!

+1 on using anti-freeze for the coolant! Make sure its aluminum compatible.

anti-freeze for the coolant! Make sure its aluminum compatible.

I think you would be hard pressed to find a car antifreeze that is not AL compatible these days.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T15:48:32.616Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":15,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":238,"readers_count":237,"score":102.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/16","custom_user_title":"2974 Robot Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3075509,"name":"Emily Yngstrom","username":"Boganafogansee","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/boganafogansee/{size}/132148_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T17:56:04.970Z","cooked":"

While I can’t comment on the air cooled spindle side of the question I have a few observations about the water cooled spindle from the couple of years we’ve been using one. I’m not convinced that having a cooling radiator is entirely necessary if you just use a pond pump and a 5 gallon bucket with antifreeze in it. Its the setup we’ve been using since 2018 and so far its worked well and kept the spindle cool.

The biggest issues we ran into with water cooling was when our seal on the bucket wasn’t the best and mdf dust started getting in over time that began to clog up the loop. We also initially used gm dexcool as that’s what a mentor had at the time but that was extremely corrosive to the plastics of the pond pump and slowly just disintegrated it. We now use rv/marine antifreeze as its far less corrosive on the plastics in the system and is actually super cheap as well though not sure how much that matters as the system retained a large amount of the initial volume from when we filled it until we changed over the rv coolant 3 years later.

I seem to remember when looking into getting a new spindle for a separate project about 5 years ago I saw a lot about air spindle needing a break after a certain amount of time of running while water cooled could run continuously. Not sure if thats even an issue with the spindles you’re looking at but might be something to look at.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T17:56:04.970Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":243,"readers_count":242,"score":98.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"Emily Yngstrom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":34357,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"She/Her"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/17","custom_user_title":"She/Her","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3075510,"name":"Smtopps","username":"Smtopps","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/smtopps/{size}/166758_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T18:06:45.046Z","cooked":"

What

Boganafogansee:

The biggest issues we ran into with water cooling was when our seal on the bucket wasn’t the best and mdf dust started getting in over time that began to clog up the loop.

Was your spindle clogged or just the lines. How did you clear the clog as our spindle has been clogged from when our router sat inaccessible in the school during closures and summers.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T18:06:45.046Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":17,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":230,"readers_count":229,"score":91.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"Smtopps","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33408,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/18","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3075512,"name":"JamesCH95","username":"JamesCH95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jamesch95/{size}/1200_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T18:28:17.881Z","cooked":"

Note: there are many coolants (antifreezes) that are not toxic that will work in a spindle (being low-temperature and generally non-pressurized).

To flush cooling systems after cleaning I sort out a way to add water to one location and drain it out of another, really flushing things clear instead of circulating and diluting over and over again.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T18:28:17.881Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":228,"readers_count":227,"score":70.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":413867,"topic_slug":"cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation","display_username":"JamesCH95","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3782,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cnc-router-spindle-air-vs-water-cooling-recommendation/413867/19","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3075514,"name":"Emily Yngstrom","username":"Boganafogansee","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/boganafogansee/{size}/132148_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T18:52:05.783Z","cooked":"

The spindle itself was clogged. Wasn’t a full clog but the decreased flow rate became noticeable and the temperature of the spindle was noticeably warmer but not anything concerningly hot.

We cleaned it out by running the fluid back and fourth through the spindle a couple times then filling the spindle with liquid while both tubes were off and using air to blow down one of the fittings with. We repeated this a lot of times. I don’t recall if we turned the spindle on for some of this or if we left it off. Of course we can’t verify visually that the passage is entirely clear but we can observe that crap stopped coming out of the fitting after a few times of blowing into it and that after cleaning the flowrate was dramatically increased as well as the spindle being back normal operating temperature during cutting. While we just used our hands no hotspots were observed afterwards and since we make sure to check the spindle temp often and to check that the coolant is clean and as well that the flowrate is not impeded.

What did you use for coolant? I suspect that in your instance given the appearance of the issue from sitting that its some type of calcification or corrosion issue filling it up. If it is something like calcification one thing I might do is look into if something like clr would work to clean it out. Please don’t do this before looking it up to see if it would damage anything internally as its only just a random idea I had, i have no idea if it could damage other things internally.
